thread.title: Top cross country teams wrap up regular season at E.P. "Tom" Sawyer
thread.title_full: Top cross country teams wrap up regular season at E.P. "Tom" Sawyer

author: courier-journal.com
title: Top cross country teams wrap up regular season at E.P. "Tom" Sawyer
text:
E.P. “Tom” Sawyer State Park on Saturday played host to the NCAA Cross Country Pre-Nationals, with the University of Louisville’s men and women’s teams placing 11th and fifth, respectively, amid a field of top-ranked teams.
Edwin Kibichiy led the men’s team in the 8K race with a 13th-place finish at 23:34.0. Japhet Kipkoech finished 23rd with a personal best of 23:41.3. Benadate Cheruiyot paced the women with a time of 21:07.9 in the first 6K race of the season, good for 11th place. Claire Noser finished 30th.
The University of Kentucky men’s team stumbled to a 25th-place finish with the women coming in at No. 41. Spencer Hrycay paced the men at 78th overall and Jacob Thompson, a top runner who got caught up in traffic early, placed 123rd. Katy Kunc finished at No. 31 for the women.
The University of Colorado, a defending two-time champion, reigned supreme in the men’s race while the University of Michigan secured the women’s title. Thomas Curtin of Virginia Tech and Erin Clark of Colorado were crowned individual winners in each race.
The men's side featured 11 ranked teams in the latest coaches poll, with four others receiving votes. Three of the 11 are ranked inside the top 10, which includes No. 1 Colorado. The women's race featured eight ranked teams, five of which rank in the top eight.
Conference championships are up next for Louisville and Kentucky, both slated for Oct. 30.
